means: 红鹳，火烈鸟（羽毛粉红、长颈的大涉禽）

sentence.Network_en: We met at a bar called the Flamingo.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在一家名为“火烈鸟”的酒吧相遇。

sentence.Network_en: This is the only species of flamingo in the region, easily recognized by its pink plumage.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是那个地区唯一一种火烈鸟, 很容易凭粉红色的羽毛辨认出来.

sentence.Network_en: But even the management of the Flamingo was impressed by Dame Blanche!
sentence.Network_cn: 但即使这样,佛莱明戈的经理都对我们的布兰奇夫人印象深刻!

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Spanish flamengo, earlier form of flamenco (see flamenco); associated, because of its colour, with Latin flamma 'a flame'

entry.def: A flamingo is a bird with pink feathers, long thin legs, a long neck, and a curved beak. Flamingos live near water in warm countries.

means.word_mean: 1. large pink to scarlet web-footed wading bird with down-bent bill; inhabits brackish lakes

auth_sentence.content: It is surprising how patchy The Killers' albums have been, a trend bucked by Brandon Flowers' solo album Flamingo.

stems_affixes.word_buile: flame[n.火焰,火苗;热情;光辉 v.发火焰,燃烧]+ing……的→adj.熊熊燃烧的;热情的
flame[n.火焰,火苗;热情;光辉 v.发火焰,燃烧]+able表形容词→flammable易燃的
inflame[v.使燃烧;激怒]+able表形容词→inflammable可燃烧的,可激怒的
inflame[v.使燃烧;激怒]+atory表形容词→inflammatory让别人着火→使激怒的;煽动性的
flam火焰+e→n.火焰,火苗;热情;光辉 v.发火焰,燃烧
